Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\base\Formatter

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\base\Formatter » yii\base\Component » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable
Subclassesyii\i18n\Formatter
Available since version2.0
Source Code
Formatter provides a set of commonly used data formatting methods.

The formatting methods provided by Formatter are all named in the form of asXyz(). The behavior of some of them may be configured via the properties of Formatter. For example, by configuring $dateFormat, one may control how asDate() formats the value into a date string.

Formatter is configured as an application component in \yii\base\yii\base\Application by default. You can access that instance via Yii::$app->formatter.

Property Details

$dateFormat property
string $dateFormat = 'Y/m/d'

The default format string to be used to format a date using PHP date() function.

$timeFormat property
string $timeFormat = 'h:i:s A'

The default format string to be used to format a time using PHP date() function.

$datetimeFormat property
string $datetimeFormat = 'Y/m/d h:i:s A'

The default format string to be used to format a date and time using PHP date() function.

$nullDisplay property
string $nullDisplay = null

The text to be displayed when formatting a null. Defaults to '(not set)'.

$booleanFormat property
array $booleanFormat = null

The text to be displayed when formatting a boolean value. The first element corresponds to the text display for false, the second element for true. Defaults to ['No', 'Yes'].

$decimalSeparator property
string $decimalSeparator = null

The character displayed as the decimal point when formatting a number. If not set, "." will be used.

$thousandSeparator property
string $thousandSeparator = null

The character displayed as the thousands separator character when formatting a number. If not set, "," will be used.

$behaviors property read-only
yii\base\Behavior[] getBehaviors( )

list of behaviors attached to this component

Method Details

init() method
void init( )

Initializes the component.

format() method
string format( $value, $format )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
$format string|array The format of the value, e.g., "html", "text". To specify additional parameters of the formatting method, you may use an array. The first element of the array specifies the format name, while the rest of the elements will be used as the parameters to the formatting method. For example, a format of ['date', 'Y-m-d'] will cause the invocation of asDate($value, 'Y-m-d').
return string the formatting result
throws yii\base\InvalidParamException if the type is not supported by this class.

Formats the value based on the given format type.

This method will call one of the "as" methods available in this class to do the formatting. For type "xyz", the method "asXyz" will be used. For example, if the format is "html", then asHtml() will be used. Format names are case insensitive.

asRaw() method
string asRaw( $value )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as is without any formatting.

This method simply returns back the parameter without any format.

asText() method
string asText( $value )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as an HTML-encoded plain text.

asNtext() method
string asNtext( $value )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as an HTML-encoded plain text with newlines converted into breaks.

asParagraphs() method
string asParagraphs( $value )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as HTML-encoded text paragraphs.

Each text paragraph is enclosed within a <p> tag. One or multiple consecutive empty lines divide two paragraphs.

asHtml() method
string asHtml( $value, $config = null )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
$config array|null The configuration for the HTMLPurifier class.
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as HTML text.

The value will be purified using yii\helpers\HtmlPurifier to avoid XSS attacks. Use asRaw() if you do not want any purification of the value.

asEmail() method
string asEmail( $value )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as a mailto link.

asImage() method
string asImage( $value )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as an image tag.

asUrl() method
string asUrl( $value )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as a hyperlink.

asBoolean() method
string asBoolean( $value )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as a boolean.

See Also

  • $booleanFormat
asDate() method
string asDate( $value, $format = null )
$value integer|string|\DateTime The value to be formatted. The following types of value are supported: - an integer representing a UNIX timestamp - a string that can be parsed into a UNIX timestamp via strtotime() - a PHP DateTime object
$format string The format used to convert the value into a date string. If null, $dateFormat will be used. The format string should be one that can be recognized by the PHP date() function.
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as a date.

See Also

  • $dateFormat
asTime() method
string asTime( $value, $format = null )
$value integer|string|\DateTime The value to be formatted. The following types of value are supported: - an integer representing a UNIX timestamp - a string that can be parsed into a UNIX timestamp via strtotime() - a PHP DateTime object
$format string The format used to convert the value into a date string. If null, $timeFormat will be used. The format string should be one that can be recognized by the PHP date() function.
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as a time.

See Also

  • $timeFormat
asDatetime() method
string asDatetime( $value, $format = null )
$value integer|string|\DateTime The value to be formatted. The following types of value are supported: - an integer representing a UNIX timestamp - a string that can be parsed into a UNIX timestamp via strtotime() - a PHP DateTime object
$format string The format used to convert the value into a date string. If null, $datetimeFormat will be used. The format string should be one that can be recognized by the PHP date() function.
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as a datetime.

normalizeDatetimeValue() method
integer normalizeDatetimeValue( $value )
$value mixed The datetime value to be normalized.
return integer the normalized datetime value

Normalizes the given datetime value as one that can be taken by various date/time formatting methods.

string asInteger( $value )
$value mixed The value to be formatted

Formats the value as an integer.

asDouble() method
string asDouble( $value, $decimals = 2 )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
$decimals integer The number of digits after the decimal point
return string the formatting result.

Formats the value as a double number.

Property $decimalSeparator will be used to represent the decimal point.

See Also

  • $decimalSeparator
asNumber() method
string asNumber( $value, $decimals = 0 )
$value mixed The value to be formatted
$decimals integer The number of digits after the decimal point
return string the formatted result

Formats the value as a number with decimal and thousand separators.

This method calls the PHP number_format() function to do the formatting.
